snippet: Syrian rebels in embattled Aleppo highlighted small gains in the midst of a withdrawal from the most contested area of the city, as government forces fired on their positions.
abstract: Syrian rebels in embattled Aleppo highlight small gains in the midst of a withdrawal from the most contested area of the city, as government forces fire on their positions with jets, helicopters, artillery and tanks.

byline.original: By DAMIEN CAVE and ALAN COWELL
byline.contributor: Damien Cave reported from Beirut, and Alan Cowell from Paris. Reporting was contributed by an employee of The New York Times from Aleppo, Syria; Hala Droubi from Dubai, United Arab Emirates; Dalal Mawad and Hwaida Saad from Beirut; Thomas Erdbrink from Tehran; and Rick Gladstone from New York.

lead_paragraph: Syrian rebels in embattled Aleppo highlighted small gains in the midst of a withdrawal from the most contested area of the city, as government forces fired on their positions.

headline.seo: With Claim and Counterclaim, Aleppo Offensive Enters Second Day
headline.main: War of Words and Arms Amid Assault in Syrian City
headline.print_headline: War of Words And Arms Amid Assault In Syrian City

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
keywords.name: subject
